case.name: Adelaide Brighton Cement Ltd (ACN 007 870 199) v Wong [2008] FCA 496 (16 April 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: consultancy and management fee stipulated by agreement between head contractor and australian-based engineering company and its director (the appellant)
consultancy work largely performed by appellant in nigeria
appellant also subsequently employed as plant manager by head contractor
whether consultancy and management fee constituted "foreign earnings derived by the person from foreign service"
nature of relationship between head contractor and appellant before appellant became plant manager
whether that of employer and employee.
peters (wa) ltd v petersville ltd trade practices
appellant manufactured and sold ice cream products in western australia under the "peters" marks
respondents manufactured and sold ice cream products under the "pauls" marks nationally and under the "peters" marks in every state except western australia
sale of respondents' western australian ice cream business to appellant
sale agreement provided that the appellant be granted the exclusive right and licence to use the "pauls" marks in western australia in return for percentage royalty
sale agreement contained covenant restraining respondents from selling ice cream products in western australia
restraint coextensive with duration of licensing arrangements but extended to ice cream products to which licensing arrangements not applicable
whether restraint is one to which the common law restraint of trade doctrine applies. trade practices
circumstances in which the restraint of trade doctrine does not apply
whether "sterilisation of capacity test" should be adopted in australia. trade practices
development of common law respecting restraint of trade
relationship between doctrine of "restraint of trade" and trade practices act 1974 (cth).
high court rules, o. 26, r. 18. patents
use for services of commonwealth or state
construction of carriages for use in state railway system
injury by accident arising out of or in course of employment
option of dependants to apply for compensation or take other proceedings
award of compensation obtained by widow on behalf of herself and children
effect of award as barring claim by dependants under lord campbell's act
the 1946 workers' compensation rules, rr. 8, 81.* practice
rules of the supreme court (vict.), order xxv., rr. 2, 4.
